triples.name: Swarm robotics
triples.relevance: The paper advances swarm robotics by integrating biological organisms with control theory to develop intelligent autonomous systems.

triples.name: Control theory
triples.relevance: Control theory is essential for designing the programmable control mechanisms that enable the cyborg insects to execute swarm navigation algorithms.

triples.name: Robot
triples.relevance: Cyborg insects are presented as alternative hybrid robots that offer advantages over conventional robots in terrain adaptation and energy efficiency.

triples.name: Swarm intelligence
triples.relevance: Swarm intelligence concepts underpin the coordination mechanisms enabling multiple cyborg insects to operate cohesively without centralized control.

triples.name: Motion planning
triples.relevance: The swarm navigation algorithm addresses motion planning challenges specific to navigating unknown obstructed soft terrain.
